books.author: by Bill O'Reilly and Martin Dugard
books.description: The host of “The O’Reilly Factor” recounts the final years of World War II.
books.name: KILLING THE RISING SUN

books.author: by Michael Lewis
books.description: How the psychologists Daniel Kahneman and Amos Tversky upended assumptions about the decision-making process and invented the field of behavioral economics.
books.name: THE UNDOING PROJECT

books.author: by Chip Gaines and Joanna Gaines with Mark Dagostino
books.description: The couple who star in the HGTV show “Fixer Upper.”
books.name: THE MAGNOLIA STORY

books.author: by J.D. Vance
books.description: A Yale Law School graduate looks at the struggles of the white working class through the story of his own childhood in the Rust Belt.
books.name: HILLBILLY ELEGY

books.author: by Megyn Kelly
books.description: The anchor of Fox News’s “The Kelly File” discusses the personal and professional challenges she has faced.
books.name: SETTLE FOR MORE

books.author: by Lin-Manuel Miranda and Jeremy McCarter
books.description: The libretto of the Grammy-, Tony- and Pulitzer Prize-winning musical, annotated by its creator, along with backstage photos and interviews.
books.name: HAMILTON: THE REVOLUTION

books.author: by Ron Chernow
books.description: A biography of the first Treasury secretary. Originally published in 2004 and the basis of the Broadway musical.
books.name: ALEXANDER HAMILTON

books.author: by Donald Stratton with Ken Gire
books.description: An eyewitness account of Pearl Harbor by a 94-year-old veteran.
books.name: ALL THE GALLANT MEN

books.author: by Lauren Graham
books.description: Essays by the star of “Gilmore Girls” (both the original and the mini-series) and “Parenthood.”
books.name: TALKING AS FAST AS I CAN

books.author: by Thomas L. Friedman
books.description: How the accelerating pace of technology, globalization and climate change are reshaping the world, and what we can do about it.
books.name: THANK YOU FOR BEING LATE

books.author: by Tim Tebow
books.description: The Heisman Trophy winner writes about overcoming obstacles.
books.name: SHAKEN

books.author: by Trevor Noah
books.description: A memoir about growing up in South Africa by the comedian, now the host of “The Daily Show,” whose parents had an illegal (under apartheid) interracial relationship.
books.name: BORN A CRIME

books.author: by the Dalai Lama and Desmond Tutu with Douglas Abrams
books.description: A discussion between two spiritual leaders about how to find joy in the face of suffering.
books.name: THE BOOK OF JOY

books.author: by Bernie Sanders
books.description: The Vermont senator and former candidate for the Democratic nomination for president delivers his message of social and economic justice.
books.name: OUR REVOLUTION
